result.execSummary:
The defendant Randell Romell Matthews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges and assessments. To be paid while on probation or serve 10 days in HOC, consecutive.  To make regular monthly payments.

Seek and maintain fulltime employment. Do job searches until he finds a job.
Participate in job training program if unable to find full time employment.
**9/22/2014 attend all appointments and to provide a log sheet for all job search attempts.
No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Work toward paying child support payments.
Pay all supervision fees, to make regular monthly payments.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug tests and breathalzers. Shall be tested twice per month randomly.

timeConds.notes:
Consecutive.  STAYED: to be used by the agent for any violations. Shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second, and 60 days for the third.
****Sept. 22, 2014/Judge Fiorenza. Commitment to be ordered forthwith directing defendant to serve 10 days straight time as condition time in the HOC for non-compliance with conditions of probation.
******12/15/2015  Balance STAYED.  For use at the agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randell Romell Matthews

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 12/15/2014:  showing amended statute/charge as should be.

Defendant Randell Romell Matthews in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC agent also in court.
Defendant is on track.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.  No further reviews requested.  aw
Request and order to correct clerical error in Judgment of conviction, signed and filed.  aw

Clerk made error in defendants charges in this case.  Case was amended on 6/24/2014 to a misdemeanor.  Defendant entered a plea to the amended information and was sentenced on 6/24/2014.  Charges should have been a unclassified misdemeanor, Possession of THC.  aw
Probation report, received and filed.  aw
Court memo received and filed, requesting condition time.  aw

Defendant Randell Romell Matthews in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Agent Florence present.  James Bowers appears with attorney Schwarz.

The request of the agent for imposed condition time is granted by the court.  Court ordered 10 days condition time imposed and to begin forthwith.  Court also ordered the defendant to attend ALL appointments and to provide a log sheet for all job search attempts.

Defendant is remanded to the Sheriffs Department to begin serving the condition time.  Case is adjourned for probation review hearing in Branch 3.

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 12-15-2014 at 08:30 am.
Court review memo, received and filed.  aw
REVIEW HRG SHOWING

Defendant Randell Romell Matthews in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  COURT ORDERED TO BE SERVED STRAIGHT TIME, NO RELEASE PRIVILEDGES.  Court gives credit for 4 days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 1 YEAR with the following conditions:

- 90 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 60 days for the third violation.

- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month, randomly.  
- Seek and maintain full time employment.  Defendant to do job searches until he finds a job.
- Participate in a job training program, if unable to find full time employment.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
- Work toward paying child support payments.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

CASE ADJOURNED FOR PROBATION REVIEW HEARING ON 9/22/2014 AT 8:30 AM, BRANCH 3.  

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw


  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed.   aw

Scheduling conference scheduled for 04-02-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Randell Romell Matthews in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding Case #10CF006241 that is already attached to the complaint.
Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Michael Dix.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 3.

Court advises defendant he is to cooperate with JusticePoint and all conditions of bail.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Randell Romell Matthews in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Randell Romell Matthews in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
